Articles.Content:
Hi All

I've been having some difficulty with my SRB Thrust limiters lately.

When I have a symmetrical set (pair/four) of SRBs on a vessel, it used to be that when I adjusted the thrust on one, the other members of the grouping also adjusted to match

Recently however, I have to adjust the individual SRBs independently.

Has something been changed in the mechanics of the game? Or have I pressed something inadvertently that changes the way these have to be adjusted?

Thanks
If you add them symmetrically they should all change, if you added them one by one, then you might have to change them manually.

Welcome to the forums, good sir.

As Mr Noobton neglected to extend this courtesy, I believe his paycheck will be docked accordingly.

2 hours ago, Cpt Kerbalkrunch said:

 his paycheck will be docked accordingly.

You know that moderator don’t have a paycheck, right?

 

Apart from paying more attention to symmetry another trick its to copy(alt+click) a previously tweaked SRB to reduce the amount of slider dragging.

 

I don’t think there is something in stock you may had changed without noticing. Maybe if you are using a Editor Extensions or similar mod.

11 minutes ago, Spricigo said:

You know that moderator don’t have a paycheck, right?

Ha. I was just being funny.

Or maybe I should say "trying to".

Hmm - OK - Well the SRBs are definitely being added symmetrically, not individually.

I'l mot aware of any mods I have installed which may impact it...I do have about 60 odd installed, but nothing I can think of  that impacts the VAB...
